channel.title: Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT
channel.description: Recent content in Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT

item.title: krishi-IoT | Deploy the Eclipse Kapua, an open source IoT Cloud Backend Platform
item.description: As per our architecture post and the priorities, our plan is to try and use the promising open source IoT cloud backend platform - the Eclipse Kapua as our backend.

item.title: Smart Watering | Update from the Farm-Team: Main hub server, part one
item.description: We are using a Raspberry Pi Model B+ with the current Raspbian (Jessie) and a 32 GB SD card. Setting up Eclipse Mosquitto on Raspbian was really easy as its available in the Raspbian main repository.

item.title: dgator | Updating Topic Data
item.description: In this post I will describe one way how the Topics data can get updated and thus aggregated.

item.title: Agrinode | Tutorial: Build a Configurable Eclipse Kura Application via Reactive Blocks
item.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to build a Kura application into a bundle by using Reactive Blocks.

item.title: Antipollution | Car Antipollution System
item.description: Goal: To control the problem of pollution through effective monitoring by environment officials, to reward the people following proper norms, and to help user to diagnose the car and keep it e-healthy.

item.title: krishi-IoT | krishi-IoT: More love to Vorto
item.description: Our team loved the Eclipse Vorto project as it offers great benefits to different players of an IoT solution together - Device manufacturers, IoT platform vendors and Solution developers. Here’s the crux of the Vorto and its benefits.

item.title: Eneristics | Project Update — Let’s Build a RHDS System from Scratch (part 1)
item.description: In this tutorial we will outline how we built our “Energy Modelling” system that measures conduction, heat loss through the building envelope.

item.title: Agrinode | Update AgriNode bundle for Eclipse Kura (using Bitreactive)
item.description: In this post, I update the “AgriNode bundle” which runs on Eclipse Kura platform.

item.title: Sergevas | Rule-Based Fault Management for Environmental Monitoring IoT system Hardware setup
item.description: For the hardware part of the system I’m using two DIY environmental sensors where each sensor consists of two parts: the external part, mounted on the outside of the window and the internal part, mounted in the apartment of the apartment building.

item.title: InMoodforLife | Eclipse Vert.x the perfect reactor for IoT devices
item.description: This time we have opted for a Reactive approach based on Eclipse Vert.x. Vert.x is a toolkit for building applications on top of the JVM, another cool Open Source project of the Eclipse Foundation.

item.title: dGator | Create a Topic
item.description: The curl command below will create a new Topic that will aggregate the IoT data of the supplied topicURI. Below is the data portion of the response.

item.title: Smart Watering | Update from Farm-Team: Building a power independent solar battery circuit
item.description: Connected 6V solar panel to battery with Z-Diode to battery and the battery than directly into the RAW input of the Arduino board. I used 3.6V (3x1.2V) NiMh battery.

item.title: InMoodforLife | Is my Pi strong enough?
item.description: We need to be able to run all the algorithms for collecting and analyzing the data in a way more modest setup: an autonomous, always running, humble Raspberry Pi that will be installed near the Beddit sensor (in Bluetooth LTE range). Is it strong enough?

item.title: WaziUp | IoT Challenge Fish Farming
item.description: The team from Easy Global Market composed of Sabrine, Charlotte, Franck and me Benjamin are currently working on Waziup Project and more precisely on the MVP water part of the project.

item.title: Agrinode | Develop an AgriNode bundle for Eclipse Kura (using Bitreactive)
item.description: In my previous post: MOSQUITTO (MQTT BROKER) DEMO. (MQTT broker is installed into a Gateway with host IP: 172.16.1.1:1883). In this demo, I build a bundle which is installed in Kura.
